author: savannah.221b

review: As a person who has decided to hold out for cable, I love the Roku Stick because it lets me watch all my streaming services. It took me a while to decide which steaming device to go with. I rent a home so I can't run cables as I please through a WWII era house. Our wifi modem was installed on the upper right hand side corner bedroom while our TV was literally diagonally the opposite in the first floor living room.We used my dvd player to connect to netflix, that wasn't fun. We depended more on our tablets and computers for Netflix, Amazon Prime and Hulu.The Roku stick has a much stronger built in antenna that hides behind your tv, you literally just point the remote or your phone towards the tv. I love the versatility I have of being able to take this small stick along with its power adaptor from the living room to the bedroom. For me this is the best streaming device.I previously had a sony streaming thing until it fell and broke while moving, I've used a samsung dvd player but none have given me so many option:hulu, netflix, amazon instant video, youtube, pandora, spotify, tune in, amazon cloud player, target ticket, and much more.

review: This is a very good compact unit that competes handily with Chromecast. However, many  HDMI ports on TV's are close together and the unit will not fit as delivered. Roku will supply an HDMI pigtail to correct the problem and you can order it for free from the Roku website. They require your unit serial number to order it. This is an inconvenience that you shouldn't have to endure.  The short adapter cable ships standard with Chromecast, but not with the Roku stick. This should be standard as well with the Roku stick as it is needed more often than not to properly fit most TV HDMI ports properly.
